subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|水|朝|alt1=氵|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p|t1=water}}.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
"Rising tide in the daytime" > "tide" (in general).

Derived from {{och-l|朝|morning}}. Compare {{och-l|汐|evening tide; ebb}} < {{och-l|夕|evening}}.

subSections.title: Readings
Usage notes
subSections.text: * Both {{ja-l|潮}} and {{ja-l|汐}} have the ''kun''-readings of ''shio'' and ''ushio''. Archaically, tides in the morning were called {{m|ja|朝潮|tr=asashio}}, the term for tides at nighttime was {{m|ja|夕汐|tr=yūshio}}. For tides at any time of day, {{m|ja|潮汐|tr=chōseki}} may be used.

subSections.title: Compounds
Alternative forms
subSections.text: * {{sense|for tides in the [[evening]]}} {{ja-l|汐}}
